page.title: 02Farming-1
page.content:
The{mild damp climate}here enables grass to grow quickly and gives a long growing season, so that the farmer can graze his cattle out of doors for a good part of the year this means he does not need to use as much expensive fodder to feed his animals. Most of the crops grown are{fodder crops}but potatoes are also grown as a{cash} {crop.}
Few workers are needed on a dairy farm because most of the work is done by machinery. The workers though are tied to their work and cannot get much time off as the cattle have to be milked twice daily, usually between 6.45 am and 8.30 am and then again between 4.30 pm and 6.00 pm. There is also the responsibility of looking after the cattle properly.
